title: LPG EXPORT TERMINAL IN WEST COAST OF BC
description:
Denali Projects was a key contributor in designing the ship loading infrastructure for the first LPG terminal on Canadaâ€™s West Coast. This work was primarily focused on the process, mechanical and EI&C engineering design related to the Jetty. Including a total of over 7 km of combined piping associated with ship loading activities and utilities.  Approximately half of the piping had to be routed and installed with the existing infrastructure of the neighboring facilities coal loading infrastructure.
Denali Projects was also responsible for integrating numerous other utilities associated with the facility including incoming fuel gas utility, ground flare and firewater systems.
